title: Beyond The Pump: What Falling Oil Prices Mean For U.S. Producers
teaser: The plunging prices are good news for drivers, but beyond low gas prices, we look at what it means for U.S. oil producers and the economy.
contentencoded:
Oil prices have plunged more than 40 percent since July, to a five-year low, and they continue to fall. As of Wednesday morning, crude was trading belowÂ $62 a barrel.

That’s good news for drivers, but beyond low gas prices, what does it mean for U.S. oil producers, and the economy?

Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson talks to Juli Niemann, a financial analyst with Smith Moore and Company.

Guest

  • Julianne (Juli) Niemann, financial analyst with Smith Moore and Company.
